Tak Bayar Hutang, Pendiri Pabrik Ponsel Cina Dilarang Hidup Mewah
04 Nov 2019, 01:56 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pendiri perusahaan ponsel merek Smartisan di Cina, dilarang naik kereta cepat dan pesawat di negaranya sendiri karena perusahaannya tidak mematuhi keputusan pengadilan untuk masalah kontrak.
Pendiri Smartisan, Luo Yonghao, juga dilarang untuk bermalam di hotel mewah, bersenang-senang di klub malam mewah, klub golf, membeli properti, ikut asuransi premium dan menyekolahkan anak di sekolah swasta yang mahal, berdasarkan perintah dari pengadilan Danyang di Cina bagian selatan, dikutip dari Reuters.
Pengadilan mengeluarkan perintah tersebut karena Smartisan gagal memenuhi keputusan pengadilan terkait perselisihan kontrak dengan perusahaan elektronik setempat.
Luo melalui media sosial Weibo meminta maaf kepada para kreditur dan investor, dia berjanji akan membayar utang-utangnya.
Luo menyatakan Smartisan berutang 600 juta yuan karena bisnis menurun sejak tahun lalu, tapi, 10 bulan terakhir mereka menghasilkan 300 juta yuan.
Merk Smartisan di Cina memang tidak sebesar kompetitornya seperti Huawei, Xiaomi atau Oppo. Luo, sang pendiri, terkenal dengan pernyataan-pernyataannya yang kontroversial di media massa, termasuk salah satunya akan mengakuisisi Apple.
ByteDance, perusahaan induk Tik Tok, membeli sejumlah hak paten dari Smartisan, dan sedang mengembangkan ponsel dari paten tersebut.
Smartisan pekan lalu meluncurkan ponsel baru, COO Wu Dezhou menyatakan kebanyakan tim mereka pindah ke ByteDance setelah akuisisi paten tersebut untuk mengerjakan ponsel dan perangkat keras. Luo, menurut Wu, sudah keluar dari tim karena alasan pribadi.

Not Paying Debt, Founder of Chinese Cellphone Factory is Prohibited from Luxurious Living
Nov. 04 2019, 01:56 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The founder of the Smartisan brand mobile phone company in China, is prohibited from taking a fast train and aircraft in his own country because his company does not comply with court decisions on contractual matters.
Smartisan's founder, Luo Yonghao, was also barred from staying overnight in luxury hotels, having fun at luxury night clubs, golf clubs, buying property, taking premium insurance and sending children to expensive private schools, according to orders from the Danyang court in southern China, quoted from Reuters.
The court issued the order because Smartisan failed to fulfill the court's decision regarding a contract dispute with the local electronics company.
Luo through Weibo social media apologized to the creditors and investors, he promised to pay his debts.
Luo said Smartisan owed 600 million yuan because business had declined since last year, but in the last 10 months they had earned 300 million yuan.
The Smartisan brand in China is indeed not as big as its competitors like Huawei, Xiaomi or Oppo. Luo, the founder, is famous for his controversial statements in the mass media, including one of which will acquire Apple.
ByteDance, Tik Tok's parent company, bought a number of patents from Smartisan, and is developing a cell phone from the patent.
Last week Smartisan launched a new cellphone, COO Wu Dezhou said most of their team moved to ByteDance after the acquisition of the patent to work on cellphones and hardware. Luo, according to Wu, had left the team due to personal reasons.
